Title: Requires a liability insurer that has an opportunity to settle a claim at or within the policy limits, and refuses to do so, to be liable for any verdict in excess of the insurance policy limits
Summary: Requires a liability insurer that has an opportunity to settle a claim at or within the policy limits, and refuses to do so, to be liable for any verdict in excess of the insurance policy limits; prohibits the insurer from recovering such excess judgment from the insured.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to requiring a liability insurer that has received an offer to settle a claim at or within the policy limits, and refuses to do so, to be liable for any verdict in excess of such policy limits
